verses.roman:
bhaṭṭa kahe,-bhakta-gaṇa āila jāniñā
prabhura iṅgite prasāda yāya tāṅrā lañā

synonyms: bhaṭṭa kahe—Sārvabhauma Bhaṭṭācārya said; bhakta-gaṇa—all the devotees; āila—have come; jāniñā—knowing; prabhura—of Lord Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu; iṅgite—by the indication; prasāda—remnants of the food of Jagannātha; yāya—go; tāṅrā—all of them; lañā—taking.
translation: Sārvabhauma Bhaṭṭācārya said, "Understanding that all the devotees have come, Lord Caitanya gave the sign, and therefore Vāṇīnātha and the others have brought such great quantities of mahā-prasāda."
